title: More Bits from Blinkbonny. ... Second edition
author: Strathesk, John
snippet: The rays of the setting sun were tinging with golden hue the bright green of the fresh foliage; the clear stream of the Blinkie Burn, as it crept down by the Annie Green, sparkled or shimmered between its banks, where the hawthorn was hoary with blossom, and the leaves of the poplar, alder, and birch trees flickered from glowing green to downy whiteness. The burn was lost to sight as it crept round the Kirk Brae, where the windows of the church aud manse glimmered as if they had been on fire; but it reappeared on the south side, emerging apparently out of a wooded ravine, crept round the back of the village in many a winding stream, and onwards through Strathbonny, until it joined the river which flowed through the strath.

title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: and rough Kirk Brae at a break-neck pace ; while Juden totally unable to comprehend what had taken place in front, partly drew up as the female rolled by the way-side, near the gate of the place ofBruntisfield.
